info.name: Recipe Remix
info.description:
Greetings and welcome to the Remix Recipe API Documentation. Our aim is to provide you with a comprehensive guide to ensure a seamless developer experience.

The Remix Recipe API is composed of six primary collections, each catering to different use cases, including but not limited to:

1. Auths Collection: This collection handles the authentication aspect utilizing Auth0 as its backend. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Login: This endpoint logs in a user and grants access to the system with the appropriate headers.  
    b. Logout: This endpoint logs out the currently logged-in user.
2. Recipes Collection: This collection is responsible for handling all CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations related to recipes. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Fetch Recipe: This endpoint fetches the details of a recipe by its ID.  
    b. Create Recipe: This endpoint parses, fetches, extracts and saves a recipe into the system.  
    c. Remove Recipe: This endpoint removes a recipe by its ID.  
    d. Update Recipe: This endpoint updates the details of a recipe by its ID.  
    e. Fetch All Recipes: This endpoint fetches all the recipes that are present in the system.
3. Remix Collection: This collection is responsible for handling all CRUD operations related to remixes. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Fetch Remix: This endpoint fetches the details of a remix by its ID.  
    b. Create Remix: This endpoint saves a remix of a recipe into the system.  
    c. Remove Remix: This endpoint removes a remix by its ID.  
    d. Update Remix: This endpoint updates the details of a remix by its ID.  
    e. Fetch All Remixes: This endpoint fetches all the remixes that are present in the system.
4. Remix Types Collection: This collection is responsible for handling all CRUD operations related to remix types. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Fetch All Remix Types: This endpoint fetches all the remix types that are present in the system.  
    b. Fetch Remix Type: This endpoint fetches the details of a remix type by its ID.  
    c. Create Remix Type: This endpoint saves a new remix type into the system.  
    d. Remove Remix Type: This endpoint removes a remix type by its ID.  
    e. Update Remix Type: This endpoint updates the details of a remix type by its ID.
5. Users Collection: This collection is responsible for handling all CRUD operations related to users. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Create User: This endpoint saves a new user into the system.  
    b. Fetch All Users: This endpoint fetches all the users that are present in the system.
6. Miscellaneous Collection: This collection is responsible for housing helper APIs to test various business functionalities. It includes the following endpoints:  
    a. Health Check: A generic health check endpoint to check if the system is healthy and running efficiently.  
    b. Parse Recipe: This endpoint parses/scrapes the recipe details from a URL.  
    c. Extract Recipe: This endpoint fetches the list of ingredients, instructions, and a title from a raw text generated by OpenAI for a recipe.  
    d. AI Generate Remix: This endpoint generates the remix of a recipe using OpenAI.
    

We hope that this documentation proves to be a valuable resource as you work with the Remix Recipe API. If you have any questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.

item.name: Auths

request.description: This endpoint logs in a user and grants access to the system with the appropriate headers and returns the user back to the BASE_URL on successful authorisation.
This endpoint logs out the currently logged-in user, which redirects the user back to BASE_URL on success.

item.name: Remix

request.description: This endpoint fetches the details of a remix by its ID.
This endpoint saves a remix of a recipe into the system.

body.raw:
{
    "remix_type": "67a0979d-5f06-4bbf-8749-b630fdf6ed7f",
    "remix_raw": " 

Gluten-Free Shaheepaneer 

Ingredients: 

-1/2 cup gluten-free all-purpose flour 
-1/2 cup gluten-free bread crumbs 
-2 tablespoons soy sauce
-2 tablespoons vegetable oil
-2 tablespoons vegetable broth
-2 tablespoons tomato paste 
-2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
-1 teaspoon garlic powder
-1 teaspoon onion powder
-1 teaspoon paprika
-1 teaspoon chili powder
-1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
-1/2 teaspoon black pepper
-1/2 teaspoon white pepper
-1/2 cup crumbled paneer
-1/2 cup green peas
-1/2 cup corn
-1/2 cup Aerospace
-1/2 cup plain yogurt
-1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
-1/2 teaspoon Fallen Leaves Tea Powder
-1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom
-1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
-1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
-1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger
-1 tablespoon minced fresh garlic
-Cooking spray
-1/4 cup chopped cilantro
-1/4 cup chopped parsley
-1/4 cup diced mango

Instructions: 

1. Preheat oven to 350°F.

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, bread crumbs, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vegetable broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, chili powder, cayenne pepper, black pepper and white pepper.

3. Add the crumbled paneer, green peas, corn, Aerospace, yogurt, ground cloves, Fallen Leaves Tea Powder, ground cardamom, ground cloves, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, fresh ginger and fresh garlic. Stir until everything is evenly combined.

4. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray and pour the mixture into the dish.

5. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the center is firm and the edges are lightly browned.

6. Sprinkle the chopped cilantro and parsley on top of the shaheepaneer.

7. Top with the diced mango and serve warm. Enjoy!",
    "ingredients": [
        "-1/2 cup gluten-free all-purpose flour",
        "-1/2 cup gluten-free bread crumbs",
        "-2 tablespoons soy sauce",
        "-2 tablespoons vegetable oil",
        "-2 tablespoons vegetable broth",
        "-2 tablespoons tomato paste",
        "-2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce",
        "-1 teaspoon garlic powder",
        "-1 teaspoon onion powder",
        "-1 teaspoon paprika",
        "-1 teaspoon chili powder",
        "-1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper",
        "-1/2 teaspoon black pepper",
        "-1/2 teaspoon white pepper",
        "-1/2 cup crumbled paneer",
        "-1/2 cup green peas",
        "-1/2 cup corn",
        "-1/2 cup Aerospace",
        "-1/2 cup plain yogurt",
        "-1/2 teaspoon ground cloves",
        "-1/2 teaspoon Fallen Leaves Tea Powder",
        "-1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom",
        "-1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
        "-1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg",
        "-1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger",
        "-1 tablespoon minced fresh garlic",
        "-Cooking spray",
        "-1/4 cup chopped cilantro",
        "-1/4 cup chopped parsley",
        "-1/4 cup diced mango"
    ],
    "instructions": [
        "1. Preheat oven to 350°F.",
        "2. In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, bread crumbs, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vegetable broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, chili powder, cayenne pepper, black pepper and white pepper.",
        "3. Add the crumbled paneer, green peas, corn, Aerospace, yogurt, ground cloves, Fallen Leaves Tea Powder, ground cardamom, ground cloves, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, fresh ginger and fresh garlic. Stir until everything is evenly combined.",
        "4. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray and pour the mixture into the dish.",
        "5. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the center is firm and the edges are lightly browned.",
        "6. Sprinkle the chopped cilantro and parsley on top of the shaheepaneer.",
        "7. Top with the diced mango and serve warm. Enjoy!"
    ]
}

body.raw:
{
    "raw_recipe": " 

Gluten-Free Shaheepaneer 

Ingredients: 

-1/2 cup gluten-free all-purpose flour 
-1/2 cup gluten-free bread crumbs 
-2 tablespoons soy sauce
-2 tablespoons vegetable oil
-2 tablespoons vegetable broth
-2 tablespoons tomato paste 
-2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
-1 teaspoon garlic powder
-1 teaspoon onion powder
-1 teaspoon paprika
-1 teaspoon chili powder
-1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
-1/2 teaspoon black pepper
-1/2 teaspoon white pepper
-1/2 cup crumbled paneer
-1/2 cup green peas
-1/2 cup corn
-1/2 cup Aerospace
-1/2 cup plain yogurt
-1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
-1/2 teaspoon Fallen Leaves Tea Powder
-1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom
-1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
-1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
-1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger
-1 tablespoon minced fresh garlic
-Cooking spray
-1/4 cup chopped cilantro
-1/4 cup chopped parsley
-1/4 cup diced mango

Instructions: 

1. Preheat oven to 350°F.

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, bread crumbs, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vegetable broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, chili powder, cayenne pepper, black pepper and white pepper.

3. Add the crumbled paneer, green peas, corn, Aerospace, yogurt, ground cloves, Fallen Leaves Tea Powder, ground cardamom, ground cloves, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, fresh ginger and fresh garlic. Stir until everything is evenly combined.

4. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray and pour the mixture into the dish.

5. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the center is firm and the edges are lightly browned.

6. Sprinkle the chopped cilantro and parsley on top of the shaheepaneer.

7. Top with the diced mango and serve warm. Enjoy!"
}
